ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: If Other, please specify gender:
What is your current height? Inches
What is your current weight? (Please round to the nearest whole number. If you are currently pregnant, report your pre pregnancy weight.)
Do you think you have a problem with eating, involving avoidance or restriction of foods or your eating overall?
Have other people (for example, doctors, family members, significant others) said that you have a problem with eating, involving avoidance or restriction of foods or your eating overall?
Have your eating habits led to difficulty maintaining a sufficient weight or, if you are still growing, difficulty gaining enough weight to keep pace with your growth?
Have your eating habits led to you losing weight (in other words, if you have lost weight, this is because of avoidance or restriction and not because of a medical illness, or other reason)?
If you have lost weight, how much weight have you lost in the past 3 months (in pounds)?

Have others (for example, doctors, family members) been concerned about your weight loss, or been concerned that you are having difficulty gaining enough weight to grow, or having difficulty maintaining your weight due to your eating habits?
Have others (for example, doctors, family members) been concerned that you are not growing taller as you should due to your eating habits?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 2 = I have finished growing

ElementDescription: Have you ever been told by any health professional that due to your eating habits you were not growing as expected, or that your height was less than it should be?
Over the past month, has any health professional said that you have a nutritional deficiency due to your eating habits (for example, low iron, low vitamin B12, low vitamin C)?

Over the past month, has a healthcare professional prescribed special supplements (for example, pills, capsules, powders, or drinks containing vitamins and/or minerals and other micronutrients) specifically to help with your nutrition?
If yes to the previous question about nutritional supplements, what have you been prescribed and how much do you take each day?

Over the past month, has a healthcare professional prescribed special supplements (for example, high-calorie drinks or 'shots', or dessert-style high-calorie supplements) specifically to help you maintain or gain weight?
If yes to the previous question about supplements to help with weight maintenance or gain, what have you been prescribed and how much do you take each day?
Are you currently receiving any tube feeding (receiving food or fluid via a tube in your nose or into your stomach)?
If yes to the previous question about tube feeding, what is the name of the food or fluid product you take via the tube and how much do you take each day?
Does your eating cause you difficulties in daily functioning - that is, in how you are able to go about things each day? This might be at school/college/work or when you are at home.

Does your eating cause you difficulties in interactions with other people (for example, disagreements or arguments with parents, siblings, significant others, co-workers), or difficulty making or sustaining friendships or other close relationships?
Does your eating cause you difficulties in social situations, for example does it make it difficult for you to go out with friends, eat at school/college/work, or stay away from home?

Over the past month, have you been particularly sensitive to variation in taste (for example, noticing slight differences in the taste of foods), which has put you off eating any foods or trying any new foods?
Notes: 0 = No negative effect; 6 = Extremely negative effect

ElementDescription: Over the past month, have you been particularly sensitive to the texture or consistency of food, which has put you off eating any foods or trying any new foods (for example, do you stick to foods of a certain texture only or have you had difficulty eating foods that have different textures mixed together such as pasta with sauce or sandwiches)?
Notes: 0 = No negative effect; 6 = Extremely negative effect

ElementDescription: Over the past month, have you been particularly sensitive to the appearance of food, which has put you off eating any foods or trying any new foods (for example, if food does not look 'right', such as burnt ends of chips/fries, broken biscuits/cookies, or being the 'wrong' color)?
Notes: 0 = No negative effect; 6 = Extremely negative effect

ElementDescription: Over the past month, how often have you forgotten to eat or found it difficult to make time to eat?
Over the past month, how often have you lacked enjoyment in food or eating (even if only certain foods)?
Over the past month, how often have you felt full before your meal is finished, or stopped eating sooner than others because you had had enough?

Over the past month, have you been avoiding or restricting the amount or type of food you eat because you were afraid that something bad might happen, like being sick, choking, having an allergic reaction, or being in pain?

Over the past month, have you avoided eating situations because you were worried something bad might happen, like being sick, choking, having an allergic reaction, or being in pain while eating (for example, because you might be served something you usually avoid for these reasons or because you have had a bad experience in the past?)

Over the past month have you had any physical feelings of panic or anxiety (examples might include a racing heart, sweaty palms, feeling sick) when you have seen something that has made you think something bad might happen, like being sick, choking, having an allergic reaction, or being in pain while eating?
(Child 1) Gender
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Child gender Other, specify
What is your child's height in inches?
What is your child's weight in pounds?
Do you think your child has a problem with eating, involving avoidance or restriction of foods or their eating overall?
Have other people (for example, doctors, family members, significant others) said that your child has a problem with eating, involving avoidance or restriction of foods or their eating overall?
Have your child's eating habits led to difficulty maintaining a sufficient weight or, if they are still growing, difficulty gaining enough weight to keep pace with their growth?

Have your child's eating habits led to them losing weight (in other words, if they have lost weight, this is because of avoidance or restriction and not because of a medical illness, or other reason)?

Have others (for example, doctors, family members) been concerned that your child is not growing taller as they should due to their eating habits?

ElementDescription: Have you ever been told by any health professional that due to their eating habits your child is not growing as expected, or that their height was less than it should be?

Is your child currently receiving any tube feeding (receiving food or fluid via a tube in their nose or into their stomach)?
If yes to the previous question about tube feeding, what is the name of the food or fluid product taken via the tube and how much does your child take each day?
Does your child's eating cause them difficulties in daily functioning - that is, in how they are able to go about things each day? This might be at school/college/work or when at home.

Does your child's eating cause them difficulties in interactions with other people (for example, disagreements or arguments with parents, siblings, significant others) or difficulty making or sustaining friendships or other close relationships?
Does your child's eating cause them difficulties in social situations, for example, does it make it difficult for them to go out with friends, eat at school/college, or stay away from home?

Over the past month, has your child been particularly sensitive to variation in taste (for example, noticing slight differences in the taste of foods), which has put them off eating any foods or trying any new foods?
Notes: 0 = No negative effect; 6 = Extremely negative effect

ElementDescription: Over the past month, has your child been particularly sensitive to the texture or consistency of food, which has put them off eating any foods or trying any new foods (for example, does your child stick to foods of a certain texture only or have they had difficulty eating foods that have different textures mixed together such as pasta with sauce or sandwiches)?
Notes: 0 = No negative effect; 6 = Extremely negative effect

ElementDescription: Over the past month, has your child been particularly sensitive to the appearance of food, which has put them off eating any foods or trying any new foods (for example, if food does not look 'right', such as burnt ends of chips/fries, broken biscuits/cookies, or being the 'wrong' color)?
Notes: 0 = No negative effect; 6 = Extremely negative effect

ElementDescription: Over the past month, how often has your child forgotten to eat or found it difficult to make time to eat?
Over the past month, how often has your child appeared to lack enjoyment in food or eating (even if only certain foods)?
Over the past month, how often has your child said or indicated they are full before their meal is finished, or stopped eating sooner than others because they had had enough?

Over the past month, has your child been avoiding or restricting the amount or type of food they eat, because they have said or indicated they were afraid that something bad might happen, like being sick, choking, having an allergic reaction, or being in pain?

Over the past month, has your child avoided eating situations because they said or indicated they were worried something bad might happen, like being sick, choking, having an allergic reaction, or being in pain while eating (for example, because they might be served something they usually avoid for these reasons, or because they have had a bad experience in the past)?

Over the past month has your child expressed any physical feelings of panic or anxiety (examples might include a racing heart, sweaty palms, feeling sick) when they have seen something that has made them think something bad might happen, like being sick, choking, having an allergic reaction, or being in pain while eating?

At some point in your life (either now or in the past)...have your avoidant/restrictive eating habits ever led to weight loss or made it hard for you to maintain a sufficient weight? Or have others ever been worried that your avoidant/restrictive eating habits were causing you to lose weight or keeping you from maintaining a sufficient weight? (For example, doctors, family members, etc.)

At some point in my life (either now or in the past)... did your avoidant/restrictive eating habits ever interfere with your growth? For example, did family members or doctors worry you were not growing as expected, or that your height was less than it should be, or that you weren't gaining weight as you should have been?
Notes: 0 = No, they didn't interfere with my growth, or my avoidant/restrictive eating habits started after I stopped growing; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: At some point in my life (either now or in the past)...has a healthcare professional ever said that you have a nutritional deficiency due to your avoidant/restrictive eating habits (for example, low iron, low vitamin B12, low vitamin C)?

At some point in my life (either now or in the past)...has a healthcare professional ever prescribed any of the following supplements because of your avoidant/restrictive eating habits? Select all that apply: None of the above.

At some point in my life (either now or in the past)...have your avoidant/restrictive eating habits ever caused you difficulties in any of the following? Select all that apply: In making or sustaining close relationships (including friendships).

At some point in my life (either now or in the past)...have your avoidant/restrictive eating habits ever caused you difficulties in any of the following? Select all that apply: In social situations (for example, going out with friends, eating at work, or being away from home).
At some point in my life (either now or in the past)...have your avoidant/restrictive eating habits ever caused you difficulties in any of the following? Select all that apply: None of the above.
